courses.name: Arts & Science Internship Program - Maximizing Your Experience

cmCourseInfo.description: This course is a mandatory component of the Arts & Science Internship Program (ASIP) for students admitted to the ASIP stream of their program for Year 2, and students admitted for Year 2 must successfully complete this course and receive a passing grade to gain access to the ASIP job board. The course will provide an opportunity for students to prepare for and maximize their learning and personal development through ASIP. Topics may include: self-assessment – skills, values, interests; building a career and co-op plan; skills articulation – how to identify, articulate and apply skills gained through courses and other life experiences; personal marketing documents; guided self-reflection on barriers to employment; resources and toolkits to support access for all; and co-op student panels. This course does not carry credit weight and is evaluated as Credit/No Credit. No tuition fee is associated, however an ancillary fee will be assessed. Refer to the ASIP Fees & Financial Aid website for further details. Students who enrolled in the ASIP stream of their program in Year 3 should enrol in PDC230H1.
cmCourseInfo.title: Arts & Science Internship Program - Maximizing Your Experience

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

The PDC220H1 ("PD1") course is available to all Year 2 entry students enrolled in the Arts & Science Internship Program and will include both synchronous and asynchronous components.  

The synchronous PDC220H1 LEC sections will be taking place bi-weekly starting the week of Sep 8, 2025. 

For more information on ASIP, please see: https://www.artsci.utoronto.ca/current/academics/asip . 

Delivery Instructions

This is an online asynchronous course with synchronous components. Assessed deliverables with dates will be provided at the start of the course; however, learning is mostly self-paced with an expectation that students be actively participating in the course on a regular basis. All course assessments will be conducted online. Optional synchronous components will be recorded and made available to all students, when possible. It is recommended that students have a computer with a microphone and camera in order to participate in online programming.

Lecture section options include both online and in-person synchronous delivery formats.

courses.name: Arts & Science Internship Program - Essential Skills for ASIP Success

cmCourseInfo.description: This course is a mandatory component of the Arts & Science Internship Program (ASIP) for students admitted to the ASIP stream of their program for Year 2, and students admitted for Year 2 must successfully complete this course and receive a passing grade before starting their first work term. The course will help students prepare for their first work term and optimize their chances of success in the first recruitment cycle. Topics may include: ASIP guidelines and requirements, resume and cover letter tailoring, professionalism essentials, job search essentials, interview preparation, workplace rights, health and wellbeing while in ASIP, and accessibility and EDI considerations. This course does not carry credit weight and is evaluated as Credit/No Credit. No tuition fee is associated, however an ancillary fee will be assessed. Refer to the ASIP Fees & Financial Aid website for further details. Students who enrolled in the ASIP stream of their program in Year 3 should enrol in PDC231H1.
cmCourseInfo.title: Arts & Science Internship Program - Essential Skills for ASIP Success

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:

The PDC221H1 ("PD2") course is available to all Year 2 entry students enrolled in the Arts & Science Internship Program and will include both synchronous and asynchronous components.

Lecture section options include both online and in-person synchronous delivery formats.

courses.name: Arts & Science Internship Program - Professional Skill Development I

cmCourseInfo.description: This course is a mandatory component of the Arts & Science Internship Program (ASIP) for students admitted to the ASIP stream of their program for Year 2. Students admitted for Year 2 must successfully complete this course to graduate from the ASIP Stream of their program of study. The course will help students build transferable skills essential for success in the workplace and in the evolving world of work. The course will also support and help guide students through the next recruitment cycle. Topics may include: post work-term reflection (if applicable), advanced interview skills, job search support for recruitment cycle II, and skills development modules. Skills development modules may include: design thinking, intercultural communication, problem solving, conflict resolution, universal design and ethical and sustainability-minded decision making. This course does not carry credit weight and is evaluated as Credit/No Credit. No tuition fee is associated, however an ancillary fee will be assessed. Refer to the ASIP Fees & Financial Aid website for further details. Students who enrolled in the ASIP stream of their program in Year 3 should enrol in PDC330H1.
cmCourseInfo.title: Arts & Science Internship Program - Professional Skill Development I

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

The PDC320H1 ("PD3") course is available to all Year 2 entry students enrolled in the Arts & Science Internship Program and will include both synchronous and asynchronous components.  

The synchronous PDC320H1 LEC sections will be taking place bi-weekly starting the week of Sep 15, 2025. 

For more information on ASIP, please see: https://www.artsci.utoronto.ca/current/academics/asip . 

Delivery Instructions

This is an online asynchronous course with synchronous components. Assessed deliverables with dates will be provided at the start of the course; however, learning is mostly self-paced with an expectation that students be actively participating in the course on a regular basis. All course assessments will be conducted online. Optional synchronous components will be recorded and made available to all students, when possible. It is recommended that students have a computer with a microphone and camera in order to participate in online programming.

courses.name: Arts & Science Internship Program - Professional Skill Development II

cmCourseInfo.description: This course is a mandatory component of the Arts & Science Internship Program (ASIP) for students admitted to the ASIP stream of their program for Year 2. Students admitted for Year 2 must successfully complete this course to graduate from the ASIP Stream of their program of study. The course will help students build transferable skills essential for success in the workplace and in the evolving world of work. The course will also support and help guide students through the next recruitment cycle. Topics will include: job search support for recruitment cycle II and skills development modules. Skills development modules topics will continue from PDC320H1, with an additional focus on: Project management skills including, Problem Solving and Critical Thinking, Teamwork and Leadership, Goal Setting and Planning, professional responsibility, workplace organization skills, workplace writing and communication. This course does not carry credit weight and is evaluated as Credit/No Credit. No tuition fee is associated, however an ancillary fee will be assessed. Refer to the ASIP Fees & Financial Aid website for further details. Students who enrolled in the ASIP stream of their program in Year 3 should enrol in PDC331H1.
cmCourseInfo.title: Arts & Science Internship Program - Professional Skill Development II
